antivirusEngine.info: only works when the enforcement level is set to real_time
only works when the enforcement level is set to real_time
whether to scan archives during on-demand antivirus scans
degree of parallelism for on-demand scans
which epp exclusion policy to apply. merge-> combine Microsoft Defender portal value and user defined. admin_only -> combine Microsoft Defender portal value
Entities that have been excluded from the scan

exclusions.info: exclude content from the scan by full file path
Specifies a process for which all file activity is excluded from scanning
exclusions.possible values: name (for example, cat) or full path (for example, /bin/cat)
exclusions.name: cat

antivirusEngine.info: whether to scan mount point marked as noexec as part of RTP
antivirusEngine.possible values: unmute(default)(scan all noexec mount poiunt), mute
antivirusEngine.info: exclude filesystems from RTP scan. Doesn't exclude from Quick, Full, and custom scans
whether to computes hashes for files MDE AV scans
threats (identified by their name) that aren't blocked by the product and are instead allowed to run
Restricts the actions that the local user of a device can take when threats are detected
antivirusEngine.possible values: array of string from: allow (restricts users from allowing threats), restore (restricts users from restoring threats from the quarantine)
antivirusEngine.info: control how certain threat types are handled

threatTypeSettings.info: Type of threat for which the behavior is configured
Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified
threatTypeSettings.possible values: audit(default)(threat is only logged), block(block the threat and notify), off(neither logged not blocked)

antivirusEngine.info: which threatTypeSettings policy to apply. merge-> combine Microsoft Defender portal value and user defined. admin_only -> combine Microsoft Defender portal value
number of days that results are retained in the scan history on the device including quarantined files
maximum number of entries to keep in the scan history

exclusionSettings.info: which epp exclusion policy to apply. merge-> combine Microsoft Defender portal value and user defined. admin_only -> combine Microsoft Defender portal value
Entities that need to be excluded can be specified by full paths, extensions, or file names

exclusions.info: exclude content from the scan by full file path
exclude content from the scan by file extension
Specifies a process for which all file activity is excluded from scanning
exclusions.possible values: name (for example, cat) or full path (for example, /bin/cat)
exclusions.name: cat

cloudService.info: whether cloud-delivered protection is enabled on the device or not
determines the level of diagnostics sent by the product to Microsoft
determines how aggressive Defender for Endpoint is in blocking and scanning suspicious files.
If this setting is on, Defender for Endpoint is more aggressive when identifying suspicious files to block and scan;
otherwise, it's less aggressive and therefore blocks and scans with less frequency.
cloudService.possible values: normal (default), moderate(Delivers verdict only for high confidence detections), high(Aggressively blocks unknown files), high_plus(Aggressively blocks unknown files and applies additional protection measures), zero_tolerance(Blocks all unknown programs)
cloudService.info: whether suspicious samples (that are likely to contain threats) are sent to Microsoft
cloudService.possible values: none(no suspicious samples are submitteda), safe (default)(only suspicious samples that don't contain personally identifiable information (PII) are submitted), all (all suspicious samples are submitted to Microsoft)
cloudService.info: whether security intelligence updates are installed automatically

features.info: whether module load events (file open events on shared libraries) are monitored
whether infected processes that open or load any infected file gets remediated or not

supplementarySensorConfigurations.info: whether file modify permissions events (chmod) are monitored
whether file modify ownership events (chown) are monitored
whether network socket events involving creation of raw sockets / packet sockets, or setting socket option, are monitored
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether boot loader events are monitored and scanned
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether ptrace events are monitored and scanned
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether pseudofs events are monitored and scanned
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether module load events are monitored using eBPF and scanned
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether open events from procfs are monitored by eBPF
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
whether events are enriched with metadata at source in eBPF
whether metadata of events being scanned by the antivirus engine are cached or not
whether suspicious events from Antivirus are reported to EDR

info: This is a preview feature. For these to be effective, Network Protection has to be turned on

networkProtection.info: Action to take when coming across a threat of the type specified
whether ICMP events are monitored and scanned
This feature is applicable only when Behavior Monitoring is enabled
